title: Great Lakes Storm of 1913
summary: The Great Lakes Storm of 1913 (historically referred to as the "Big Blow",[3][lower-alpha 1] the "Freshwater Fury", and the "White Hurricane") was a blizzard with hurricane-force winds that devastated the Great Lakes Basin in the Midwestern United States and Southwestern Ontario, Canada, from November 7 to 10, 1913. The storm was most powerful on November 9, battering and overturning ships on four of the five Great Lakes, particularly Lake Huron.
